Ad Text:
Job Title : Minerals Digital Process Specialist

Division : Weir Minerals

Location : Australia (Flexible – Nationwide)


Purpose of Role:  

This role plays an important part in how we support customers, enhance our digital services, and strengthen our global operating model. You will contribute to how digital tools enable process improvements, how insights are translated into action, and how our service offering continues to evolve.

As a Minerals Digital Process Specialist, you will be part of our Digital Services team, analysing operational data to generate practical insights that improve the performance and reliability of Weir equipment. You will bring a strong understanding of minerals processing, helping internal teams interpret data trends, address process challenges, and support customers in improving uptime, efficiency, and productivity.

You will collaborate closely with our global digital community and regional reliability and process teams to ensure our digital solutions reflect real operational needs. When complex process or equipment issues arise, you will work with specialists across the organisation to diagnose root causes and recommend sustainable solutions.

You will also contribute to new initiatives in minerals processing, partnering with regional teams to identify opportunities, develop insight-led solutions, and strengthen our digital capabilities. This role is well suited to someone who combines process expertise, analytical thinking, and collaboration to drive continuous improvement and deliver meaningful outcomes for customers.

Why choose Weir: Be part of a global organization dedicated to building a better future: At Weir, the growing world depends on us. It depends on us constantly reinventing, quickly adapting and continually finding better, faster, more sustainable ways to access the resources it needs to thrive. And it depends on each of us doing the best work of our lives. It’s a big challenge – but it is exciting.


An opportunity to grow your own way: Everything moves fast in the dynamic world of Weir. This creates opportunities for us to take on new challenges, explore new areas, learn, progress and excel. Best of all, there is no set path that our people must take. Instead, everyone is given the support and freedom to tailor-make their own career and do the best work of their lives.


Feel empowered to be yourself and belong: Weir is a welcoming, inclusive place, where each individual’s contribution is recognized and all employees are encouraged to innovate, collaborate and be themselves. We continually focus on people and their wellbeing. We believe in fairness and choose to be honest, transparent and authentic in everything we do.


Key Responsibilities:

Act as the global ‘go-to’ digital specialist for data analysis related to process issues, conditions, anomalies, and debottlenecking across connected and potential customers, providing expert support to internal stakeholders.

Lead the service operating model (2nd layer of specialist support), delivering high-value insights derived from customer data.

Support Industrial IoT Data Analysts (Level 1 in the service operating model) in analysing equipment performance and operational data to resolve customer challenges.

Provide process expertise to other business units (including Process Optimization), acting as a consultant to regional teams when required.

Ensure business and customer needs are effectively communicated, shared, and aligned with the appropriate specialists, integrating regional and/or technology group expertise when necessary.

Work within the Case Management tool to effectively support the IntelliServices team and manage assigned tasks.

Define and implement new service offerings leveraging process expertise.

Identify and develop case studies related to equipment and process issues, highlighting digital-driven solutions for broader organisational visibility.

Contribute innovative ideas within the digital environment to enhance customer satisfaction and continuously improve service delivery.

Safety First: Demonstrate 100% commitment to our zero harm behaviors in support of our drive towards developing a world class safety culture.


Job Knowledge/Education and Qualifications:

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Metallurgical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or a related engineering discipline.

A Master’s or PhD is advantageous.

Experience

Minimum of 8 years’ experience in minerals processing, plant operations, or related process environments.

Demonstrated experience in asset optimisation and/or process optimisation, supported by relevant qualifications, certifications, and recent hands-on data analysis exposure.

Operational or metallurgical experience gained working directly for, or in partnership with, mining operations.

Professional qualities that would support your application include:

Experience delivering operations-focused analytical and methodological support services.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with proven ability to collaborate effectively with client organisations.

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly and confidently, both verbally and in writing, in English; proficiency in a second language (Spanish preferred) is advantageous.

Demonstrated capability in producing clear, structured, and high-quality technical reports.

Founded in 1871, Weir is a world leading engineering business with a purpose to make mining operations smarter, more efficient and sustainable. Thanks to Weir’s technology, our customers can produce essential metals and minerals using less energy, water and waste at lower cost. With the increasing need for metals and minerals for climate change solutions, Weir colleagues are playing their part in powering a low carbon future. We are a global family of 11,000 uniquely talented people in over 60 countries, inspiring each other to do the best work of our lives.


For additional information about what it is like to work at Weir, please visit our Career Page and LinkedIn Life Page.

Weir is committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

About Raspite

Raspite is a business consulting firm specialising in safety and risk management.

Established in 2025, we are a growing business with a strong and stable pipeline of projects with major organisations.

We partner with clients to strengthen their safety management system and improve how the manage operational risks. Our clients include large mining, utilities and construction companies seeking to better control risks that could lead to serious injuries and fatalities.

About the Role

Working from home and within client offices and worksites, you will collaborate with stakeholders across all organisational levels to:

Conduct audits and gap assessments

Develop action plans to address issues and opportunities

Oversee and deliver agreed improvement actions

We're looking for a detail-focused Senior Consultant with strong analytical ability, a technical mindset and a passion for clear documentation and structured project delivery. You will analyse data, prepare documentation, and develop high-quality presentations to support project outcomes. A methodical, organised professional who enjoys working with data, documents and systems, and who can operate effectively in complex operational environments

Key Responsibilities

Scope projects, ensuring clarity on objectives, deliverables and inclusions

Develop project management plans

Establish, manage and report on project schedules

Engage multiple stakeholders across management, engineering, operations and maintenance

Analyse data to identify incident trends and patterns

Conduct risk assessments

Draft high-quality documents including reports, policies, procedures, forms and other supporting materials

Develop change management materials such as slide packs and communications to support organisational change

Qualifications

A tertiary qualification in one of the following (or similar)

Engineering

Safety

Business

Law

Psychology

Skills and Experience

An understanding of WHS legislation, concepts and frameworks

Experience and strong knowledge of safety risks and controls in heavy industry environments such as mining, utilities, construction or manufacturing

Strong data analytical skills with the ability to identify trends and patterns

High proficiency with Microsoft 365 to develop polished documents and presentations

What We Offer

Our people are central to our success, and we strive to be a respected and sought-after employer. This permanent, full-time position offers:

Hybrid working arrangements (work from home, client offices and worksites, occasional travel)

Support for ongoing education and professional development

The opportunity to share in company profits aligned with individual contributions

Australian citizenship or permanent residency is required.

Your New Company
Medium sized Company in the energy/renewables space.  Ideal size for growing your career, big enough to have real challenges, yet small enough to matter and influence outcomes.  Work in a collegiate, supportive, professional, and diverse culture.  Provide support to some of Australia's sharpest energy professionals doing innovative things.  Enjoy flexible working arrangements, normal working hours in one time zone (far less than the big multinationals), and a place where your ongoing study is supported and in most cases reimbursed if job related.  There is good reason the average tenure of staff is much longer than it's peers, it is simply a great place to work.

Your New Role
With growth comes expansion.  This newly created role sits under the FP&A lead, ultimately rolling up to the CFO's office.  As the name suggest, you are the hands on analyst providing - financial planning (medium/long range), analysis (business cases, projects, variances, strategic insights, and also support financial planning tools including an upcoming implementation of a leading global planning technology.  Your reports will be seen both internally and externally, exhibiting your formal writing skills.  You'll deliver operational/business performance analysis with insights, trends, and opportunities by manipulating data.  You will both create and update financial models, monitoring changing business dynamics regularly.  You will also leverage technology including the use of AI, Coding, PowerBI and a TBA planning tool coming in shortly.

Your Profile
Though the role is "analyst", it requires a few years of finance experience and preferable an advanced qualification (CA, CPA, CFA, MBA, Masters in related Field) and a degree in a business/finance discipline (economics, accounting, finance, or related).  Whilst you are naturally inquisitive, curious and analytical, you are also personable, with influencing skills and superior ability to take the complex and put it in plain English to a variety of stakeholders.  You thrive in roles where you have both core duties and project based work to keep you on your toes, balancing regular reporting/analysis with once off business cases, what if scenarios, and deep dives into data.  

The keys to being appointed would be demonstrating a strong mix of commercial acumen in business (getting the big picture, strategic thinking) with the ability to utilise technology to deliver decision support and key information.  You have depth in MS Excel financial modelling, exposure to coding/programming (R/Python or similar), and are keen to be a key player in an upcoming planning tool implementation.  You likely earned distinctions or high distinctions in your studies.  You will have examples of insights and analysis you've created in the past that we're acted on for a positive result - and be able to articulate this meaningfully during interviews.

Your Application
To secure this exciting and rare FP&A opportunity, which will position you on the path to CFO in the longer term, please apply today with your up to date CV.  As this is a growth/talent development opportunity within the company, we will favour you for your upward career trajectory and impressive accomplishments.  For immediate consideration, please apply now, and your application will be reviewed by Eric Macias in real time.  The role is to be filled ASAP, as the role has been created and there is much to be done!  We will wait for you if you have a notice period, quality over timing, but the sooner the better.  Unfortunately, sponsorship is not considered due to urgency/timing.  

Please note, this will be a multiple interview process, requiring work rights, police check, drug/alcohol screening, and positive professional references.  

About Macias Consulting
Macias sets the gold standard in recruitment with our 4-way matching methodology ensuring (1) you can do the job, (2) you'll enjoy doing the job, (3) you'll fit into the company whilst doing the job, and (4) you'll be able to deliver excellent results.   Perth's top employers choose Macias for our high touch service, market knowledge, thorough vetting, and common sense approach to recruitment.  The best talent works with us for access to our network of hiring managers built over the past 15 years in the WA market, often under the radar, exclusive opportunities not found anywhere else.  Even if we don't place you, we can help you, please visit us for your complimentary CV template and review how we operate at www.maciasconsulting.com.au.  You can also see recently placed positions, we cover qualified accounting roles all the way up to CFO, and are also specialist in corporate finance/M&A/Strategy/Commercial.

TheDriveGroup has partnered with a national ticketing brand who are performing a data migration of customer data. This a large project with tight deadlines.The role focuses on accurate and secure migration of customer, membership and transactional data while supporting multiple client migrations running in parallel. To be successful you MUST HAVE:


Migration Analyst
Data migration experience
CRM or Saas experience
Ticketing or membership platform experience desirable 
hands-on Data mapping and reconciliation experience
Detail orientated and confident in supporting cutover- critical activities
Fast paced environment


This role will be a hybrid working arrangement within Sydney CBD. 3 days in the office and 2 days from home. Interviewing and making a decision this week. If you would like a private and confidential discussion then please HIT APPLY

It needs someone with a strong Business Analyst background who is comfortable in gathering requirements and has strong documentation to communicate between the team and the vendor. To be successful you MUST HAVE:


Delivery Lead
Business Analyst background
Agile Delivery
Data Project experience 
Strong Documentation
Strong Communication
Stakeholder Management skills
This client is a household reputable brand in a very agile environment. They are happy with someone working remotely within Australia ideally on the east coast. It will be a remote role with a two stage interview process. They can interview this week. If you would like a private and confidential discussion about the role then please HIT APPLY
